revised_title: An Analysis of Binary and Ternary Encounters in Gases
tldr: The author presents two theories to analyze the probability of encounters between gas molecules, focusing on binary and ternary encounters. The first theory uses a cubic cell approach, while the second theory considers a spherical shell surrounding a molecule. Both theories show deviations from the law of Guldberg and Waage at high densities, with the second theory providing a more accurate measure of encounters.
